page.title: 15G.W.R.150 HISTORY E.SWINDON
page.content: Summer Term 1985 {150 years ago}this August, an act was passed by parliament enabling the planning and construction of{The Great {Western Railway}to proceed. Because{I.K.Brunel}chose Swindon to be the half way station between London and Bristol for changing engines and also to make and repair locomotives and other rolling stock, Swindon became a modern industrial town, no longer the{medieval "Swine hill". Because this event was so important, all of the Swindon schools have been studying, The G.W.R., I.K.Brunel, Victorian Swindon and railways in general. (Which hasn't left a great deal of time to work on the Domesday Project.)
